channel.title: TIC TEK TOE
channel.description: Marcel Gagne and Evan Leibovitch riff on Linux, Open Source, computers, technology, privacy, the digital economy, movies, video games, the Internet, security, breakfast cereal, and anything else related to the modern, open world.
channel.author: Marcel Gagne & Evan Leibovitch
channel.itunes:author: Marcel Gagne & Evan Leibovitch
channel.itunes:summary: Marcel Gagne and Evan Leibovitch riff on Linux, Open Source, computers, technology, privacy, the digital economy, movies, video games, the Internet, security, breakfast cereal, and anything else related to the modern, open world.

item.title: Don't Know Much About AI Art, But I Know What I Like!
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 030. Marcel and Evan dissect the topic of art created by Artificial Intelligence using tools like Dall-E, Midjourney, and Marcel's current favorite, Stable Diffusion, and try to see if this is the beginning of the end of the world. Most specifically, the world of art, for artists.  What does the word, "the", mean to an AI? Also, the boys compare notes on what they did during their summer, discuss music and musical covers, and argue vehemently over whether "Don't Stop Believing" by Journey is, in fact, a good song. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: The Obsolescence Episode
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 029. Marcel and Evan riff, again, on the subject of virtual worlds, wherein Marcel gets ordained as a priest in an imaginary church, gets an honorary doctorate at an imaginary university (you can call him Dr. Marcel, if you like), and obtains dual citizenship from an imaginary country. Between the two of them, they discuss what any of this means in a world that is becoming increasingly virtual. Evan, meanwhile, tries out his new microphone and complains bitterly about tech hardware obsolescence. Who can blame him?


--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: The Metaverse Is Boring!
item.description:
This is "TIC TEK TOE" episode 028 and one for which I (Marcel) must apologize up front. I decided to wear my gaming headset and just assumed that it would be just fine for the podcast. Instead, it's noise cancelling microphone cancelled far more than it should have and my audio sounds clipped and occasionally vanishes into the pits of wherever audio goes. Evan, on the other hand sounds just fine.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Living Dangerously and Taking Public Transit
item.description:
This is episode 027 of TIC TEK TOE, your light-hearted look at whatever comes into your hosts' heads. In today's episode, Evan and Marcel discuss slowly getting back out into the (hopefully increasingly) post pandemic world and what it feels like to travel right now. Evan heads east into Quebec and Marcel heads into Niagara Falls for an overnight stay. They discuss wine, feel-good television as a pandemic salve, fear, Jon Stewart's new show, fear, Ted Lasso and sportsball shows, fear, autism in movies and television, fear, aphantasia, a condition whereby a person has no 'inner eye' to visualize, fear, and what we did during the summer break (SPOILER: Marcel started making games in Unity). 

Fear not, and enjoy!

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Che Guevara Posters and the Freedom to Be a Schmuck
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 26! Marcel and Evan discuss why neither owns a Che Guevara poster, hard to find centrists, progressophobia, why you really should not feed the trolls, platforming and deplatforming, empathy, moral panics, the future of work, the coming collaps of the commercial real estate market, Zoom, real live people, embracing avatars, Yoda (not baby Yoda), and dark circles. In short, the boys cover a lot of ground and, as usual, have trouble staying on topic. Heck, I can't even remember what the topic was. Enjoy!


--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Amazon Deliveries on Mars!
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 25! Woo Hoo!  Marcel and Evan discuss the ethics of killing NPCs in video games, simulation theory wars, and why an otherwise respectable university would sabotage its standing in the Linux community. That last bit is juxtaposed with Evan making a blasphemous presentation at the Toronto Linux User Group, GTALUG. The boys also cover running graphical Linux apps in Windows, old style book printing and publishing, turtles, dwarves, giants, and tardigrades. Today's episode features the quintessential Canadian story, and yes, it involves a beaver. Or two. Now that we have drones on Mars, can Amazon deliveries on the Red Planet be far behind? 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Cheesy NFT Graphics
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 024, the episode they said we would never do. Marcel and Evan discuss cheese, because . . . well . . . CHEESE! The boys discuss their favourite types, chat about declining attendance in US churches and synagogues and whether Trump has anything to do with it. Because NFTs are a thing now, Marcel and Evan find ways to make fun of them, while decrying the insane price of graphics cards (assuming you can even get them), and whether this whole crypto thing just needs to go away. Then, there's that thing about RMS returning to the FSF which brings up the question of whether the FSF is even still relevant. The boys also discuss the man who should have been the 46th President of the US but will probably become mayor of the city that never sleeps, Andrew Yang. 


Remember to tell others about the show. Like, share, subscribe, comment, and all that stuff!

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: The Evil Episode . . . Eeeeeevil!!
item.description:
This is episode 023 of TIC TEK TOE, and we're calling this one "The Evil Episode" because it's all about evil, specifically who is evil, who isn't, and just what constitutes evil these days. Once upon a time, especially to those in the Free and Open Source Software (aka FOSS) world, it was Microsoft. These days, however, there's Google, Apple, Facebook, and Amazon (aka GAFA) fighting it out for the crown of ultimate evil. And Microsoft? They're starting to look like one of the good guys. The boys also discuss the banning and/or cancelling of Dr. Seuss, the de-sexing of Mr and Mrs Potato head, the Mars lander and what wind sounds like on Mars. Oh, and Marcel used the wrong microphone source in recording so his audio is kind of subpar. 


--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Embrace The Cringe
item.description:
This is episode 022 of TIC TEK TOE. Marcel and Evan discuss cracking open a cold one, in this case fizzy water, renovation porn, the stock market along with the latest sort-selling GameStop madness, the awesome power of Reddit, the possibly even more awesome power of Elon Musk, Signal, MeWe, Animaniacs, and PSYCH. Oh, and Schitt's Creek, too!

Links from the Show

Sodastream discussion, spawned from me cracking open a cold one (PC fizzy water).

Fusion Flavours (where Evan buys his mad scientist fizzy water supplies)

Renovation porn subreddit

Note: ANYONE WHO TAKES FINANCIAL ADVICE FROM MARCEL AND EVAN ARE IDIOTS!

Wall Street, GameStop, etc. Some background.

The wallstreetbets subreddit (Marcel called it wallstreetwatch on the show; he was wrong)

Leverage "The rich and powerful, they take what they want"

Elon Musk and Signal

Mewe.com

Animaniacs

PSYCH

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: The Back End of 2020 and Exploding Rockets
item.description:
In this final episode of 2020, number 21, Marcel and Evan ask what the big deal is with one day changes of date while really wanting to see the back end of this particular year. They then meander down the path of picking up new skills, video games, ad blockers, virtual reality (again), exploding rocket ships, and why Elon Musk is the perfect Bond Villain. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Magic TV Unicorns
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 020.  Today, Marcel and Evan discuss why televisions are so cheap, even those huge things that you struggle to find space for on your wall, the awesome comedy, "Superstore", a wrap for season 2 of "The BOYS", Google's cloud gaming platform, Stadia, the cost of modern video games, where concerts have gone during the pandemic, the quest for an open Metaverse, and whether it's okay to kill virtual beings, even if they are zombies and other versions of the undead. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message
item.dc:creator: Marcel Gagne & Evan Leibovitch

item.title: No More Travel For You, but Have Some Cheese!
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 019. Marcel and Evan start out discussing cheese and its precursor, milk, move on to meat, including the plant based alternatives, Incredible Burger and Beyond Meat, after which Evan does his best to alienate GMO's foes. Moving on to a discussion of ultra-violence on TV with shows like Preacher and The Boys, the two slip into anime and video games. From there, it's VR, the end of business travel as we know it, including conference SWAG, open source virtual reality, and a teaser about an upcoming discussion where Marcel will point out why Evan just does not even begin to understand how intelligent technology is supposed to work. On, and Marcel coins a new word, "Ostimates", a combination of "Optimistic" and "Estimates." Make sure you use it everywhere! Finally, please support our little podcast by telling others about it and leaving us a rating wherever you find your podcasts. Thanks for listening!

Links From The Show

PREACHER and ultra violence, The BOYS, Watchmen, Pulp Fiction, etc. 

One Punch Man, the Anime series, including the video game.

The Oculus Quest 2 has arrived

Spatial, vSpatial, Immersed, and Facebook's own version/vision

The Logitech VR supported keyboard (no, we aren't being paid by Logitech, unless that is, they want to pay us).

Vircadia, an open source VR metaverse

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Spying Devices in My House and Internet ID Cards
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 018, where Marcel and Evan discuss whether anyone is real but you, dear listener, are presumably and hopefully really who you are. In today's show, Marcel and Evan discover that there musical tastes may not be entirely discerning, Evan foists some really bizarre music on Marcel as Marcel backs away slowly, Marcel suggests that perhaps we need a kind of Internet ID card, Evan expresses his distrust for "in home listening devices", and the pair discuss artificial and virtual beings. 


--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message
item.dc:creator: Marcel Gagne & Evan Leibovitch

item.title: An Open Source Canadian in Microsoft's World
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE episode 017.  In today's show, Marcel drags Evan into the rabbit hole he's been exploring for the last couple of weeks. After fighting to get his Roblox on under Windows, not to mention Unity 3D development work for world development on the Oculus Quest, Marcel decides to stop fighting and give in to the dark side, setting up a Windows machine and plugging his nose. All is not lost however, as Marcel tries to make his Windows system look and behave more like a Linux system. Is this the end of the world? Will lightning strike our heroes? Has Hell frozen over? Listen and find out.

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message
item.dc:creator: Marcel Gagne & Evan Leibovitch

item.title: Talk To My Avatar
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 016. Today, Marcel finally gets Evan to watch UPLOAD and grills him on the show. The guys discuss the increasingly rapid development cycles on the Oculus Quest, including VR games as well as business offerings. AltspaceVR tries to rush ahead of the long-delayed Facebook Horizons. Marcel and Evan share their experience with ImmersedVR, talk about the brewing legal battle between Slack and Microsoft, and consider the differences in video chat apps. Oh, and Marcel gets a new avatar. 

Links from the show

Show Links

Facebook Horizons teaser : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Is8eXZco46Q
AltspaceVR : https://altspacevr.com
ImmersedVR Desktop : https://immersedvr.com
Slack vs Microsoft : https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/22/slack-has-filed-an-antitrust-complaint-against-microsoft-teams-in-the-eu/

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Living On in VR and YouTube Death Matches
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 015. Today, Marcel and Evan visit the afterlife in VR, consider the world's loudest 21 seconds of silence, consider some Microsoft and Open Source conspiracy theories, wonder at the beauty of chroma key and Zoom backgrounds, mourn over the graves of many failed products, ask the tough questions about when good news becomes bad news, and generally chat about how we never cover the topics we think we're going to cover. 

Links to topics covered 

Everyone on the GNOME board of directors works for Microsoft (Dr. Roy)

Trudeau and his 21 seconds of silence : https://youtu.be/SeaDi-0Nz8w  

Malcolm Gladwell and his "Revisionist History", specifically the LSAT episode.
Part 1 : http://revisionisthistory.com/episodes/31-puzzle-rush
Part 2: http://revisionisthistory.com/episodes/32-the-tortoise-and-the-hare

Link to the Google product graveyard (Killed by Google)

Pocket is a Mozilla project now

Bad Internet (IMDB entry)

Some Good News sells out

UPLOAD, by Amazon (IMDB entry)

Lawnmower Man, https://youtu.be/zzwPuJklv4w

My Google Home, thank you, video 

 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Reduced to the Level of YouTuber Unboxing Videos
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 014.  Today's episode, which was recorded last week but Marcel didn't edit until today, covers the ongoing COVID-19 isolation, pandemic bread and tourist food, famous chefs and food porn, an apology to Jitsi from Marcel, a happy ending for dot ORG, Universal Basic Income, Ayn Rand, buying wine during the lockdown, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, and a push from Evan for Some Good News.

Links From The Show

Twoflower, the Discworld's first tourist

That all fondue restaurant in Geneva, Hotel Edelweiss 

Jamie Oliver's YouTube Channel

Gordon Ramsay's YouTube Channel (one of them, anyhow)

Heston Bluementhal's YouTube Channel

A story about dot ORG, ICANN, and the California Attorney General

Reif Estates Winery, Jackson Triggs, and Hillebrand (Peller) Winery

Gunpowder Tea 

Revisiting Jitsi for video conferencing

Universal Basic Income (something Marcel wrote last year)

CBC Radio, Ideas: Why Ayn Rand Still Matters (part 1 and part 2)

John Oliver on Ayn Rand (How is she still a thing?)

The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel on IMDB

Some Good News channel on YouTube




--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Fear is the Mindkiller, and Battery-Operated Bidets
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 013, from deep inside the heart of self-isolation. In this episode, Marcel and Evan discuss the strange world we all find ourselves living in, the climate of fear, the hazards of grocery shopping, Zoom going zoom and its security concerns, virtual reality headsets, virtual reality social environments, toilet paper, bidets, and why it's not so different for some people out there. 

Links From The Show

Litany against fear, from DUNE, by Frank Herbert

     I must not fear.
    Fear is the mind-killer.
    Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration.
    I will face my fear.
    I will permit it to pass over me and through me.
    And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path.
    Where the fear has gone there will be nothing.
    Only I will remain.

"So, first of all, let me assert my firm belief that the only thing we have to fear is...fear itself — nameless, unreasoning, unjustified terror which paralyzes needed efforts to convert retreat into advance." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

Bill Maher, recording in his backyard, with laugh track and old recording of a "studio audience"

Klaatu, Everybody Took A Holiday

Jitsi, an open source messaging and video-conferencing client

ALtspaceVR vs VRChat VS Rec Room vs NEOS vs Hubs by Mozilla

Facebook Oculus commercial offering (Oculus For Business), including price and terms of use. 

Creating VR Worlds and Teaching Class with Mozilla Hubs, by Marcel Gagné on YouTube

The Washlet

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: TIC TEK TOE Slips Into Virtual Reality
item.description:
TIC TEK TOE, episode 012. Welcome to a bold experiment into the future of something or other. Let's be honest. It's hard to tell. Is it a podcast? Is it a virtual reality (VR) show? Is it just two guys mucking about in AltspaceVR and trying to see if it's possible to tie your shoes when there's only one controller? Marcel has been playing with VR for a long time, but Evan is a relative newcomer and Marcel, being that kind of guy, wanted to see how Evan would handle himself in this strange new world. This show is unusual in that it's both a podcast, and a YouTube video.

In this episode (if it's an episode), we discuss doing things in VR, the EU adopting Signal for instant messaging, and "Shitt's Creek", a comedy on Netflix and CBC that is mandatory viewing for all Canadians and non-Canadians alike.  And, if you want to follow along with the video portion of this show, check it out here, on YouTube. https://youtu.be/sM_H0nxilJo


--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Not that virus, Restaurants, Stupid Government Oversight, Star Trek, Picard, Bad Science, and Alcohol Consumption
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, Episode 011. In this episode, Evan finally returns from a bout with a virus, but not that Virus, even though three weeks before, he was in China, in that part of China. We also talk about how to track said virus, restaurant ambiance, stupid government laws regarding privacy and copyright, social media alternatives, the new Star Trek series, "Picard," being guilty until proven innocent, wrestling, bad science, and alcohol consumption. 

Once you're done listening, or right now for that matter, please (pretty please, even) make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. Also, if you can spare a few extra keystrokes, be sure to leave us a comment and tell us how we're doing.

Links for today's show


--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Fast Food, Stolen Cars, Ricky Gervais, Embarrassment, Monsters, Reboot, and Questionable History
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 010.  It's 2020 and time for episode 010 of the show. In a rare event, Marcel and Evan meet at a fast food restaurant following one of the most embarrassing events of Marcel's life wherein his car was both stolen and not stolen. The guys discuss other forms of embarrassment including Ricky Gervais at the recent Golden Globes, new takes on old monsters, The Order, Buffy, simulation theory, turning mundane events into video games, and some really questionable history. 

Once you're done listening, or right now for that matter, please (pretty please, even) make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. Also, if you can spare a few extra keystrokes, be sure to leave us a comment and tell us how we're doing.

Additonal Notes & Links from the Show

- Ricky Gervais monologue on the 2019 Golden Globes
- The Order on Netflix
- Buffy, The Vampire Slayer
- Underworld movie series (trailer)
- SimCity BuildIt (video)
- Reboot (TV series, YouTube clip)
- Drunk History (sample from YouTube)
- Something True (Podcast)

item.title: Happy New Year maybe, VR games, Jumanji, RISCV, The Witcher, the Overnet, and the Future!
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 009.  In this final episode of the decade, or at least, this year, Marcel and Evan riff on Christmas gifts, VR games, Jumanji, Open Hardware vs closed borders, The Witcher, and several other diversions. Somewhere in there, they reminisce over the last decade of free software, a free and open Internet (the Overnet), and lots of other things you really don't want to miss. Oh, and Marcel learns about Gwen Stacy, or is it Gaven and Stacey?

Once you're done listening, or right now for that matter, please (pretty please, even) make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. Also, if you can spare a few extra keystrokes, be sure to leave us a comment and tell us how we're doing.

Additonal Notes & Links from the Show

Pearls and Swine for the New Year
Oculus GO, Quest, and VR
Daedalus
Video play of Daedalus in VR
Land's End
Wander for Oculus
RISCV goes to Switzerland
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
Jumanji : The Next Level
The Witcher on Netflix

Oh, and Gavin and Stacey's Christmas special.

item.title: Dora, Ms. Frizzle, the Phillipines, Hardware, and Chimeras
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 008.  Marcel and Evan discuss Dora the Explorer, the Magic School Bus, how Adam ruins everything, Open Source in the Phillipines, the value of old hardware, consumer vs creator devices, licences (again) and .org (again). Cloud gaming makes another appearance and Marcel totally geeks out on the concept of human chimeras and how this might impact DNA evidence and even, wait for it, conciousness. 

Once you're done listening, or right now for that matter, please (pretty please, even) make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. Also, if you can spare a few extra keystrokes, be sure to leave us a comment and tell us how we're doing.

Additonal Notes & Links from the Show

Dora and the Lost City of Gold (trailer) : https://youtu.be/gUTtJjV852c
Dora, the "College Humor" skit : https://youtu.be/TnpTcrtsN3U
Magic School Bus Live (fan made trailer) : https://youtu.be/Rce6HTFBaFg
Adam Ruins Everything Magic School Bus Video : https://youtu.be/k8PQXiJiLOY
 (note that Adam is actually wrong on several points when it comes to Columbus, but it's still funny)
.org revisited, including this NYT article : https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/05/opinion/dot-org-domain.html
VPN Linux vulnerabilities that aren't : https://threatpost.com/linux-bug-vpns-hijacking/150891/
Human Chimeras and DNA Evidence : https://qz.com/1763584/dna-evidences-reliability-called-into-question-by-human-chimera/

item.title: Pikachu, FOSS Decade, .ORG vs Girl Scouts, Drake, and Perineum Sunning
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 007. Marcel and Evan discuss Ryan Reynold's continued redemption with Detective Pikachu, martial arts movies, VR arcades, whether a decade starts on a 0 or 1, what kind of decade FOSS has had, or is about to have had, the Internet Society and .ORG vs the Girl Scouts (our money is on the Girls Scouts), on-demand culture, Drake (yeah, that Drake), and perineum sunning. 

Once you're done listening, or right now for that matter, please (pretty please, even) make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. Also, if you can spare a few extra keystrokes, be sure to leave us a comment and tell us how we're doing.

Additonal Notes & Links from the Show

Girl Scouts protest sale of .ORG domain by the Internet Society
https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-50515786

How Open Source Changed Everything -- Again
https://www.infoworld.com/article/3481661/how-open-source-changed-everything-again.html

VR arcades: my local one is called "Ctrl-V"
https://www.ctrlv.ca/

Drake Gets Booed Off Stage
https://www.vice.com/en_ca/article/ne8xd7/a-rash-of-booing-incidents-at-concerts-reveals-that-fan-culture-is-getting-more-toxic

Perineum Sunning and Why it's a Bad Idea
https://www.health.com/mind-body/perineum-butt-sunning-wellness-trend

And, no doubt, a bunch of things I've forgotten. 

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Energy Drinks, Teen Titans GO!, Bad Superheroes, and Don Cherry
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 006. Today, Marcel and Evan discuss where our listeners are in the world, why neither Marcel nor Evan gets a kick from caffeine, what the options are when you really need that kick, open source licenses, politics, good superheroes, bad superheroes, fallen heroes, not talking about politics, whether pepperoni makes a good cough suppressant, and, $DEITY help us, Don Cherry. Also, both Marcel and Evan get more homework for episode 7.

Once you're done listening, or right now for that matter, please (pretty please, even) make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. Also, if you can spare a few extra keystrokes, be sure to leave us a comment and tell us how we're doing.

Additonal Notes & Links from the Show

Guarana Antarctic
Teen Titans GO to the Movies!
Arrowverse shows

From Batman, "You Either Die a Hero, or You Live Long Enough To See Yourself Become the Villain."
https://youtu.be/8WfRcnF4iZI
The Boys, on Amazon Prime
The Orville with Seth McFarlane

Open Core license and ethical uses of open source software
Don Cherry, "Rock 'em Sock 'em Hockey"

item.title: Canadian Election Postmortem, UNIX at 50, Superheroes
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 005. Today, Marcel and Evan discuss politics, or at least, what the recent Canadian election actually said about open ideas, oil, the Prime Minister, and the environment. We talk about Unix turning 50 and how Linux wormed its way into pretty much becoming Unix, and Marcel gives Evan some superhero homework.

Once you're done listening, or right now for that matter, make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. Also, if you can spare a few extra keystrokes, be sure to leave us a comment and tell us how we're doing.

Canadian electon results : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_Canadian_federal_election
Electoral Cartogram of Canada : https://electoralcartogram.ca/?fbclid=IwAR0J5io-ZObuQU5Uu8nj5ZvF4q1nZBNENghEIoPA-jWBJRv9bLYPbqjmKHk
Greta Thunberg Mural Defaced : https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/greta-thunberg-mural-in-edmonton-defaced-days-after-emerging-1.4647209
UNIX turns 50 (and yes, Nokia now owns Bell Labs) : https://www.bell-labs.com/unix50/

Teen Titans GO : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teen_Titans_Go!_(TV_series)
The Boys : https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Boys_(2019_TV_series)

item.title: Rhinos, Telecom, Four Freedoms, and Being Offended
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 004. Today, Marcel and Evan vote early, but not often, talk strange politics, whine about telecom charges, consider open Internet, discuss the Four Freedoms, software licenses, DUNE, George Carlin, and Dave Chapelle. 

And once you're done, make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. 

Links From the Show

Canada's Rhino Party
https://www.partyrhino.ca/en/

Aaron Swartz
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aaron_Swartz

Starlink satellite system by SpaceX
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starlink_(satellite_constellation)

Open Internet

Intelligent City Awards

Whatever happened to free city wifi?
https://www.thestar.com/business/tech_news/2016/04/17/what-became-of-torontos-push-for-free-public-wi-fi.html

God Emperor of Dune
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/God_Emperor_of_Dune

Can an Open Source Programmer decide how their software is used?
https://techcrunch.com/2019/09/23/programmer-who-took-down-open-source-pieces-over-chef-ice-contract-responds/

The "Hippocratic" License
https://www.wired.com/story/open-source-license-requires-users-do-no-harm/

The Four Freedoms (of Free Software)

A program is “free software” if the program’s users have the four essential freedoms:

1: The freedom to run the program as you wish, for any purpose.

2: The freedom to study how the program works, and change it so it does your computing as you wish. Access to the source code is a precondition for this.

3: The freedom to redistribute copies so you can help your neighbor.

4: The freedom to distribute copies of your modified versions to others. By doing this you can give the whole community a chance to benefit from your changes. Access to the source code is a precondition for this.

If software is licensed in a way that does not provide these 4 freedoms, then it is categorized as nonfree or proprietary.

https://openedreader.org/chapter/stallmans-four-freedom/

Who wrote OpenSSL?
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenSSL

Dave Chapelle, "Sticks and Stones"
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt10810424/

George Carlin, People who should be killed.
https://youtu.be/tVlkxrNlp10

The Mikado
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0163101/

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

https://www.wired.com/story/open-source-license-requires-users-do-no-harm/

The Four Freedoms (of Free Software)

A program is “free software” if the program’s users have the four essential freedoms:

1: The freedom to run the program as you wish, for any purpose.

2: The freedom to study how the program works, and change it so it does your computing as you wish. Access to the source code is a precondition for this.

3: The freedom to redistribute copies so you can help your neighbor.

4: The freedom to distribute copies of your modified versions to others. By doing this you can give the whole community a chance to benefit from your changes. Access to the source code is a precondition for this.

If software is licensed in a way that does not provide these 4 freedoms, then it is categorized as nonfree or proprietary.

https://openedreader.org/chapter/stallmans-four-freedom/

Who wrote OpenSSL?
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenSSL

Dave Chapelle, "Sticks and Stones"
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt10810424/

George Carlin, People who should be killed.
https://youtu.be/tVlkxrNlp10

The Mikado
https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0163101/

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: VR Fitness, Distrowatch, and Forget Me (not)
item.description:
TIK TEK TOE, episode 003. Today, Marcel and Evan decide to rename the show, so now it's called, "Tic Tek Toe" and not "Trash-Talking FOSS". The guys talk about VR fitness, courtesy of Marcel's Oculus Quest, Distrowatch, Lucky Charms cereal (no, really), and whether or not you have a right to be erased from the Internet. 

And once you're done, make sure you share this podcast with your friends, family, neighbours, enemies . . . just share and recommend. 

Links from the show

Oculus Quest and Beat Saber
Distrowatch Website
Distro Chooser Website (16 questions to pick a distribution)
Lucky Charms Marshmallows
Google wins partial victory in "Right to be Forgotten" case

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Stallman Resigns, Huawei does Linux, Deepin
item.description:
Tic Tek Toe, episode 002 : In this episode, Evan and Marcel discuss the recent events surrounding Richard Stallman resigning from both M.I.T. and the Free Software Foundation. We also talk about another controversy, namely the ongoing security and trade concerns around Huawei and whether we should be worried about their new laptops running Deepin Linux. Even before Huawei was on Trump's list, there were some questions as to whether Deepin might include Chinese spyware. Finally, Marcel addresses some feedback about how he ends his episodes. 

Links from this episode

Stallman Resigns From MIT and the FSF
Fall of the Clueless Nerd, from WIRED Magazine
Huawei introduces Linux laptops
Deepin Linux

--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message

item.title: Hell Freezes Over, Linux Journal Goodbye, lilocked
item.description:
This is TIC TEK TOE, episode 1. In this, the first episode, Evan and Marcel discuss the signs that hell has frozen over as Richard Stallman speaks at Microsoft. They also discuss the end of Linux Journal and how that relates to traditional publishing, how to make money in an increasingly free digital age, and a new exploit targeting Linux servers. Sort of. Also, Marcel wants to register a complaint.

Links

Another sign of the End Times: Free software guru Richard Stallman speaks at Microsoft HQ
https://www.theregister.co.uk/2019/09/05/richard_stallman_microsoft/

Linux Journal : An Awkward Goodbye
https://www.linuxjournal.com/content/linux-journal-ceases-publication-awkward-goodbye

Thousands of servers infected with new Lilocked (Lilu) ransomware
https://www.zdnet.com/article/thousands-of-servers-infected-with-new-lilocked-lilu-ransomware/


--- Send in a voice message: https://anchor.fm/tic-tek-toe/message
